paragraphs.content: If-Else statements allow for specific blocks of code to be executed only if a specified condition is either true or false.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create an if statement
paragraphs.content: The example below shows how to create an if statement on its own; without an else or else if (covered later in the topic). The if statement is used to specify a block of code which is to be executed only if the condition (in the brackets) is true.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create an else statement
paragraphs.content: The example below shows how to create an if statement with an else statement. The else statement is used to execute a block of code (specified within the else curly brackets) only if all of the other conditions are false.

paragraphs.subheading: How to create an else-if statement
paragraphs.content: The example below shows how to create an if statement with an else-if statement and an else statement all together!
The else-if statement is just like a regular if statement with the exception that it specifies a seperate condition in its own brackets.
You can as many else-if statements as you desire whereas, you can only have one if and one else statement.

paragraphs.subheading: Tips to remember with If-Else statements
paragraphs.content: Remember that the if statement must be the first condition in an If-Else statement block, with the else-if's going after it and the else being the final condition if all the other conditions return false.
Also, else statements and else-if statements within an If-Else block are NOT REQUIRED. You can have an if statement on its own however, you cannot have just an else-if or an else on its own.
